page.title: 10Wildlife.
page.content: As our block is in a very rural area there is an abundance of wildlife.From our classroom we see rabbits playing and grey squirrels in the trees which form our boundary.There are many foxes and we have seen large badger setts in a wood near school.While on a walk in a disused quarry we saw a very large hare.Stouts and weasels are frquently seen.Unfortunatly even in our quiet area hedgehogs are frequently killed by vehicles.Molehills can be seen in the fields and gardens of the area. During the summer months lizards, grass snakes and slow worms can be seen.20 years ago an adder made its way into our school.Frog spawn and toad spawn is to be found in our numerous small ponds and ditches. Our area is home to a great number of field mice rats and voles the school cat once brought home a wild mink.
